alert.note: Alert for Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 16 at 3:32PM CDT until October 17 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 11 inches in the higher elevations around the Penokee Range. * WHERE...Iron County. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This snow will likely be heavy and wet. Use caution when removing snow. Allow for breaks as needed.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
